etymology.description: 人民 (people) + 日报 (daily newspaper) = people’s daily newspaper/title.
etymology.interpretation: Official daily newspaper of the Communist Party of China; literally “the people’s daily newspaper.”
etymology.simplification: Only 报 was simplified from 報 in PRC reforms to reduce strokes; 人, 民, and 日 are unchanged. High-frequency press term, so stroke reduction improved writing efficiency.

examples.chinese: 我每天读《人民日报》(我每天讀《人民日報》)。
examples.english: I read People’s Daily every day.

examples.chinese: 《人民日报》是中国共产党的机关报(《人民日報》是中國共產黨的機關報)。
examples.pinyin: 《Rénmín Rìbào》 shì Zhōngguó Gòngchǎndǎng de jīguānbào.
examples.english: People’s Daily is the official newspaper of the Communist Party of China.

examples.chinese: 这篇文章发表于《人民日报》头版(這篇文章發表於《人民日報》頭版)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piān wénzhāng fābiǎo yú 《Rénmín Rìbào》 tóubǎn.
examples.english: This article was published on the front page of People’s Daily.
